p: According to the authors of the new paper, increased income from rising food prices could potentially mitigate the effects of climate on stunting, but only if it is combined with adequate work with decent pay for rural farmworkers. 4 “In other words, reducing poverty and inequality among rural communities would be expected to reduce both undernutrition and the vulnerability of nutritional status to climate change,” explains lead author Simon Lloyd, a research fellow at the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine. “No previous work has considered that possibility.”
